intro: Hacquetia bracteogama, commonly known as the bracteate hacquetia, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Poaceae, commonly known as the grass family. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, spike-like inflorescences. Its flowers are typically pale green to blue in color, and it blooms during the warmer months. Hacquetia bracteogama is often found in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and wetlands.
